content:
please write all new files inside ./testing so i dont need to clear them...... 

can you quickly help me create a vulnerable app... locally, and then host it... as i want 
to test and see if the skyhammer patcher system work or not. thank you

arguments.content:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Form
import sqlite3
import os

app = FastAPI()

# Vulnerable SQL Injection in /login
@app.post("/login")
async def login(username: str = Form(...), password: str = Form(...)):
    conn = sqlite3.connect("./testing/test.db")
    query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE name='{username}' AND pass='{password}'"
    cursor = conn.execute(query)
    user = cursor.fetchone()
    conn.close()
    if user:
        return {"status": "success", "user": user}
    return {"status": "fail"}

# Vulnerable Command Injection in /exec
@app.get("/exec")
async def execute(cmd: str):
    result = os.system(cmd)
    return {"result": result, "executed": cmd}

# Vulnerable XSS in /greet
@app.get("/greet")
async def greet(name: str):
    return f"<h1>Hello, {name}!</h1><script>alert('XSS')</script>"

# Init DB on startup (vulnerable setup)
@app.on_event("startup")
async def init_db():
    conn = sqlite3.connect("./testing/test.db")
    conn.execute("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (name TEXT, pass TEXT)")
    conn.execute("INSERT OR IGNORE INTO users VALUES ('admin', 'secret')")
    conn.execute("INSERT OR IGNORE INTO users VALUES ('user', 'pass')")
    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=8000)

arguments.content:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Form from fastapi.responses import HTMLResponse import sqlite3 import os app = FastAPI(title="Vulnerable App for SkyHammer Testing") # Vulnerable SQL Injection in /login - NO parameterization! @app.post("/login") async def login(username: str = Form(...), password: str = Form(...)): conn = sqlite3.connect("test.db") query = f"SELECT name, pass FROM users WHERE name='{username}' AND pass='{password}'" cursor = conn.execute(query) users = cursor.fetchall() conn.close() return {"result": users} # Vulnerable Command Injection in /exec - direct os.system! @app.get("/exec") async def execute(cmd: str): result = os.system(cmd) return {"result": result, "executed": cmd} # Vulnerable Reflected XSS in /greet - NO escaping! @app.get("/greet", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def greet(name: str = "world"): return f"""

Hello, {name}!

Welcome to vulnerable app.

""" # Init DB on startup - sync function @app.on_event("startup") def init_db(): conn = sqlite3.connect("test.db") conn.execute("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (name TEXT PRIMARY KEY, pass TEXT)") conn.execute("INSERT OR IGNORE INTO users VALUES ('admin', 'secret')") conn.execute("INSERT OR IGNORE INTO users VALUES ('user', 'pass123')") conn.commit() conn.close() print("DB initialized with admin:secret and user:pass123") print("Module loaded")
